ans.reasoning: The 'append' method in EqualsBuilder is responsible for comparing two objects. The failure in the test suggests that the comparison logic may not be handling BigDecimal objects correctly, leading to an unexpected result when comparing o1 and o2.

The 'isEquals' method simply returns the value of the isEquals variable. If the comparison logic in the 'append' method fails, this method will return an incorrect result, contributing to the test failure.

The constructor of EqualsBuilder initializes the object. While it is less likely to be the source of the fault, if the initialization does not set up the state correctly, it could indirectly affect the comparison logic.
